story:
Hello there, young Brazilian boy!

Let me take you on a magical journey to the land of Brazil, where the sun always shines bright and the music of samba fills the air.

Once upon a time, in the heart of the Amazon rainforest, there was a little monkey named Lua (which means "moon" in Portuguese). Lua loved to explore the lush forest, climbing up tall trees and swinging from vine to vine. He was always getting into mischief, playing tricks on his friends and making them laugh.

One day, Lua stumbled upon a hidden clearing deep in the forest. In the center of the clearing stood an enormous tree, its branches twisted and gnarled with age. Luna noticed that the tree was covered in glowing, iridescent leaves that shimmered like diamonds in the sunlight.

As he approached the tree, Lua heard the most enchanting music coming from within. It was the sweet, lilting rhythms of Afro-Brazilian drums and the soft, soulful voice of a samba singer. The music was so captivating that Luna felt himself swaying to the beat, his feet tapping out the rhythm on the forest floor.

Suddenly, a figure emerged from the tree, dressed in a brightly colored costume and a wide, cheerful smile. It was a kind, gentle witch named Maria, who told Lua that this was her magical samba tree. She invited Lua to join her on a journey through the forest, to show him the secrets and wonders that lay hidden beneath the trees.

As they danced and sang their way through the forest, Lua met all sorts of fantastical creatures: capybaras playing the maracas, toucans wearing tiny sombreros, and even a family of jaguars doing the samba on their hind legs. Everywhere they went, the music seemed to bring people and animals together, filling the air with joy and laughter.

As the sun began to set, Maria led Lua to a clearing where the entire forest was gathered to dance under the stars. The music swelled, and the forest creatures joined hands, forming a great circle of love and celebration. Lua felt his heart filled with the rhythm and energy of the forest, and he knew that he would never forget this magical night.

And so, my dear boy, I want you to remember that just like Lua, we are all connected to the magic of the forest and the power of music and dance. May the rhythms of Brazil guide you on your own journey, and may you always remember to spread joy and love to all those around you.

Falling asleep under the stars, with the sounds of samba in your ears and the spirit of Luna in your heart, I wish you sweet dreams, meu filho (my son).
